intro: Hecale, commonly known as the snowbell, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant is native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. Hecale species are generally evergreen shrubs with dense, leathery foliage. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental flowers and ability to thrive in acidic soils.
